plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A North American native wildflower known for its bright yellow petals surrounding a dark brown central cone. It thrives in prairies and open woods, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susans are the state flower of Maryland and were traditionally used by Native Americans for medicinal purposes.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub popular in gardens around the world, renowned for large, showy flowers that open in the morning and last a single day. Often grown as ornamentals in subtropical and tropical regions.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, notably prolific in late summer
plants.location: Native to East Asia; widely cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions
plants.funFact: Hibiscus flowers are edible and used to make hibiscus tea, which is rich in antioxidants.

plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant characterized by large flower heads with bright yellow petals surrounding a dark reproductive disk. Sunflowers follow the sun‚Äôs movement across the sky, a behavior called heliotropism.
plants.location: Native to North America, cultivated worldwide
plants.funFact: Sunflower seeds are harvested for oil andfood, and the plant also plays an important role in phytoremediation to clean contaminated soil.

plants.name: Kniphofia uvaria
plants.description: A striking perennial with tall spikes of tubular flowers that transition in color from red at the top to yellow at the base. It attracts hummingbirds and butterflies and thrives in well-drained soils.
plants.location: Native to South Africa; widely grown in temperate gardens
plants.funFact: Also known as torch lilies, their flower spikes can reach impressive heights of up to 1.5 meters.
